I'm using JUnit4 inside Eclipse 3.2.2. When I tell it to run a single 
test=
, it will instead run all of the tests in the class up to and 
including th=
e one I want, but will only give the results of the one I 
specified. 

Thi=
s is fine for my normal unit tests, but I also use JUnit for my 
integratio=
n tests, and some of those tests can take some time to 
complete. If I choo=
se to run a test that is physically near the bottom 
of the class, it can t=
ake minutes before it will run my test. 

Is there a way to really make it =
only run the one test you specify?
